| Types of plugins
¢ Predefined plugins

+ Used to implement customizable
behavior for predefined points in the
application

« Messaging plugins

+ Used to send messages to external systems
and process the resulting replies

¢ Startable plugins

¢ Used to listen for incoming messages from
external systems and processes them
asynchronously

username lsu Prod |Prodserver

Specify values at the registry level that can be passed to a plugin class during initialization

+ Name and Value String fields are required

+ Environment and Server fields are optional

Useful for varying plugin behavior without changing the plugin code itself

Example:

* Testing environment compared to a production environment

Plugin class must implement InitializablePlugin interface and

set Parameters property

| Using plugin parameters Gi

¢ Add the parameters in the plugin registry

¢ Reference the parameters in the plugin class

package trn.ta.plugin.exchangerate
Gosu Class: _agin.exchangerate.TmlExchangeRateSetPlugin

Envi uses gv.plugin.InitializablePlugin
STIS uses gw.plugin.exchangerate. IExchangeRateSetPlugin
Server:

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Question G

_— — (dentify if each statements true or false.

¢
ow A) Plugins implement methods that are called by internal code.

B) Plugins must be written in Gosu.

C) Aplugin class must contain a predetermined set of methods based on the
business need it serves.

D) Plugins are used exclusively for external application integration.

Se Soe Se sees esse ese

Answer

_— — |dentify if each statements true or false.

Y
, A
B
Cc

were

D

z=

g

Cc)
D

z=

&

Plugins implement methods that are called by internal code.
Plugins must be written in Gosu.

A plugin class must contain a predetermined set of methods based on the
business need it serves.

Plugins are used exclusively for external application integration.
True

False — Guidewire recommends that they be written in Gosu, but they can be
written in OSGi or Java.

True

False — They are also used to execute tasks exclusively within the Guidewire
application.

Question

an What is the purpose of a plugin registry entry?
¢
4

Se Soe Se sees esse ese

Answer

ae What is the purpose of a plugin registry entry?

¢
4

The plugin registry entry identifies the plugin class to use for a given set of internally
called methods and initialization parameters that may be used to affect the plugin's
behavior.

Soo eS oe ese Sse ese

Question

,- — Doyou need to restart the server when you:
¢

ow A) Modify code in an existing Gosu plugin?

B) Modify a plugin registry entry?

Se Soe Se sees esse ese

Answer Gi

_- — Doyou need to restart the server when you:

¢
“ A
B

Modify code in an existing Gosu plugin?

Modify a plugin registry entry?

A) No, you do not to restart the server when you make changes to a Gosu plugin
class. However, you need to execute Reload Changed Classes.

B) Yes, you need to restart the server when modifying a plugin registry entry because
plugin registry entries are initialized only during the server application start-up.

Soo eS oe ese Sse ese

Lesson
objectives ¢ Describe the basic functionality of Guidewire
review plugins

¢ Configure plugins in Gosu
* Configure plugin parameters
¢ Register and deploy plugins

| Student exercise

Create an exchange rate plugin
